summary: Barbara L. Mosley was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents detail her position and salary during that period. The specific role or department she worked in is not specified in the provided summaries, but her presence on multiple payroll certifications indicates consistent employment with the HSCA during its investigation.
significance: Barbara L. Mosley's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination, although her specific role and contributions are not detailed in the provided document summaries. Her presence in payroll records confirms her involvement in the committee's operations.
